title: WNBA All-Star: Live updates, results, analysis from Friday
description: Caitlin Clark is out, but the party in Indianapolis is on in Friday's 3-point contest and skills challenge.
author: Michael Voepel and Kendra Andrews and Alexa Philippou
excerpt: Caitlin Clark is out, but the party in Indianapolis is on in Friday's 3-point contest and skills challenge.
text: Natasha Cloud beats buzzer to win WNBA Skills Challenge (1:24)Natasha Cloud beats the buzzer with 1.1 seconds to spare, edging Erica Wheeler's 37.5 to win the WNBA All-Star Skills Challenge. (1:24)ESPNJul 18, 2025, 07:38 PM ETINDIANAPOLIS -- Indiana Fever guard Caitlin Clark is injured and not participating, but the party is beginning for WNBA All-Star Weekend. The skills challenge kicks things off in Indianapolis on Friday (8 p.m. ET, ESPN), headlined by Atlanta Dream forward Allisha Gray, who won the competition in 2024 in Phoenix.Gray will look to defend her title against a pool of guards: the New York Liberty's Natasha Cloud, the Seattle Storm's Skylar Diggins and Erica Wheeler, and the Minnesota Lynx's Courtney Williams.Then some of the WNBA's best long-range shooters will compete in the 3-point contest, where Gray will also try to defend her title. She will go head-to-head with 3-point contest record holder Sabrina Ionescu, Los Angeles Sparks guard Kelsey Plum and Washington Mystics rookie Sonia Citron.Who's going to come out on top? Follow here all night for live, on-site analysis and coverage from Indianapolis.
html:
• ESPN

Jul 18, 2025, 07:38 PM ET

INDIANAPOLIS -- Indiana Fever guard Caitlin Clark is injured and not participating, but the party is beginning for WNBA All-Star Weekend. The skills challenge kicks things off in Indianapolis on Friday (8 p.m. ET, ESPN), headlined by Atlanta Dream forward Allisha Gray, who won the competition in 2024 in Phoenix.

Gray will look to defend her title against a pool of guards: the New York Liberty's Natasha Cloud, the Seattle Storm's Skylar Diggins and Erica Wheeler, and the Minnesota Lynx's Courtney Williams.

Then some of the WNBA's best long-range shooters will compete in the 3-point contest, where Gray will also try to defend her title. She will go head-to-head with 3-point contest record holder Sabrina Ionescu, Los Angeles Sparks guard Kelsey Plum and Washington Mystics rookie Sonia Citron.

Who's going to come out on top? Follow here all night for live, on-site analysis and coverage from Indianapolis.
